intro: Campsiandra pasibensis, commonly known as the Pasibensis Campsiandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
